summary: This document appears to be notes from a December 2, 2021 meeting preparing for trial testimony, focusing on the technical details and metadata of evidence files (GX 332, GX 332B, GX 54). It discusses the process of copying a photo from a CD to a computer, the creation dates of files, and user account activity on a computer associated with Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Her name appears as a user account ('ghislaine') on the computer referenced as GX 54, with over 400 logins noted.

events.title: Trial Preparation Meeting
events.description: A meeting was held to prepare for trial testimony, focusing on the analysis of digital evidence including photos and computer metadata.

events.title: File Creation/Burn Date
events.description: The date May 7, 2002, is identified as when a photograph (GX 332) was either put on a CD or copied from a CD onto a computer.

keyFacts: Evidence file GX 332 is a picture copied from a compact disk (CD) to a computer, with its metadata (GX 332B) showing the 'created date' reflects when it was copied, not necessarily when the photo was taken.
A computer referenced as GX 54 had three user accounts, with one named 'ghislaine' showing over 400 logins, while the default 'guest' and 'administrator' accounts showed zero logins.
The document indicates that once a file is burned onto a CD, it cannot be 'unburned,' and on the original CD, the created date and modified date would be the same.
The date May 7, 2002, associated with the photo file, represents when it was put on the CD or copied/burned onto a computer, not necessarily the date the photograph was taken.
